pkgmetadata.longdescription:
A Python implementation of 3-way merge of texts.Given BASE, OTHER, THIS, tries to produce a combined textincorporating the changes from both BASE->OTHER and BASE->THIS.All three will typically be sequences of lines.Usage=====From the command-line:: $ echo foo > mine $ echo bar > base $ echo blah > other $ python -m merge3 mine base other > merged $ cat mergedOr from Python:: >>> import merge3 >>> m3 = merge3.Merge3( ... ['common
', 'base
'], ... ['common
', 'a
'], ... ['common
', 'b
']) >>> list(m3.merge_annotated()) ['u | common
', '<<<<
', 'A | a
', '----
', 'B | b
', '>>>>
']
